sen.j: 高野新笠（たかののにいがさ、生年不詳 - 延暦8年12月28日 (旧暦)（790年1月21日））は桓武天皇の生母。
sen.e: Takano no Nigasa (birth year unknown-January 21, 790) was the birth mother of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: 桓武天皇→Empeor Kanmu, Emperor Kammu 表記が２種類登録されています。Empeor Kanmu を使用しました。
sen.e: Takano no Nigasa (? - January 21, 790) was the birth mother of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: space
sen.e: TAKANO no Niigasa (? - January 21, 790) was the birth mother of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: Takano→TAKANOFBはありませんでしたが、用語修正しました。

sen.j: 光仁天皇の側室、後に大夫人。
sen.e: She was the concubine of Emperor Kojin, later Taifujin/Daibunin (a title of respect for an Emperor's mother).
She was the concubine of Emperor Kojin, later Taifujin/Daibunin (a title of respect for an Emperor's mother).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: She was the concubine of Emperor Konin, and went on to become Daibunin (also referred to as Taifujin; a title of respect for an Emperor's mother).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一方の読みを補足に含めました。referred as →referred to as

sen.j: 正式には高野朝臣新笠（たかののあそみにいがさ）という。
sen.e: Her official name was Takano no asomi niigasa.
Her official name was Takano no asomi niigasa.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her official name was TAKANO no Asomi Niigasa.
sen.cmt: Takano no asomi niigasa→TAKANO no Asomi Niigasa

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief Biography
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: Brief Biography
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 新笠は和乙継（やまとのおとつぐ）の娘。
sen.e: Niigasa was the daughter of Yamato no ototsugu.
Niigasa was the daughter of Yamato no ototsugu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Niigasa was the daughter of YAMATO no Ototsugu.
sen.cmt: Yamato no ototsugu→YAMATO no Ototsugu

sen.j: 母は土師宿禰（のち大枝朝臣）真妹である。
sen.e: Her mother was HAJI Sukumo (future Oe Ason) Maimo.
sen.cmt: 定訳不明のため下記のように訳出しました。土師宿禰（のち大枝朝臣）真妹→ HAJI Sukumo (future Oe Ason) Maimo→HAJI no Sukune (later OE no Asomi) Maimo
sen.e: Her mother was HAJI Sukumo (later Oe Ason) Maimo.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Her mother was HAJI no Sukune (later OE no Asomi) Maimo.
sen.cmt: OK土師宿禰→HAJI no Sukune大枝朝臣→OE no Asomi真妹→Maimo[http://mononobe.nobody.jp/siryou/sujroku/19syouji.htm]

sen.j: 天智天皇の孫にあたる白壁王（後の光仁天皇。生没年：709年 - 782年）の侍妾となり、733年に能登内親王、737年に山部王（後の桓武天皇）、その後早良親王を生んだ。
sen.e: She became the concubine of Shirakabe no okimi (Prince Shirakabe) who was the grandchild of Emperor Tenchi, and had Imperial Princess Noto in 733, Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) (future Emperor Kanmu) in 737, and then had Imperial Prince Sawara with him.
sen.cmt: B11,12のセルは本来一文と思われるため結合しました。データベースには、天智天皇→Tenji, Tenchi のスペルアウトが混在しています。Tenchi の方を使用しました。
sen.e: She became the concubine of Shirakabe no okimi (Prince Shirakabe), who was the grandchild of Emperor Tenchi, and had Imperial Princess Noto in 733, followed by Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe) (the future Emperor Kanmu) in 737, and then had Imperial Prince Sawara with him.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: She became the concubine of Emperor Tenchi's grandson Shirakabe no Okimi (Prince Shirakabe, the future Emperor Konin, 709 - 782) with whom she gave birth to Imperial Princess Noto in 733, Yamabe no Okimi (Prince Yamabe, the future Emperor Kanmu) in 737, and later Imperial Prince Sawara.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: だが白壁王は744年に聖武天皇皇女・井上内親王を妃とし、770年に擁立されて62歳で光仁天皇（在位：770年 - 781年）となった。
sen.e: Shirakabe no okimi married Imperial Princess Inoe, the princess of Emperor Shomu in 744, and was helped to the throne in 770; he became Emperor Kojin at the age of 62 (his reign was from 770 to 781).

Shirakabe no okimi married Imperial Princess Inoe, the princess of Emperor Shomu in 744, and was assisted in achieving the throne in 770; he became Emperor Kojin at the age of 62 (his reign was from 770 to 781).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, Shirakabe no Okimi married Emperor Shomu's daughter Imperial Princess Inoe in 744, and was backed to succeed the imperial throne, becoming Emperor Kojin in 770 at the age of 62 (he reigned from 770 to 781).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 皇后には井上内親王、皇太子にはその子、他戸親王が立てられたのは、井上の出自の高さと新笠の出自の低さのいずれから見ても至極当然であった。
sen.e: It was very natural that Imperial Princess Inoe became an empress, and her child, Imperial Prince Osabe became a prince considering their backgrounds; Inoe's origin was high while Niigasa's origin was low.

It was very natural that Imperial Princess Inoe would become an empress, and that her child, Imperial Prince Osabe, would become a prince, considering their backgrounds; Inoe's origin was high, while Niigasa's origin was low.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: When considering the high status of Inoue and the low status of Niigasa, it was only natural that Imperial Princess Inoe would become empress, and that her son Imperial Prince Osabe would become crown prince.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 新笠の生んだ皇子たちに後継の目はないかに見えたが、772年に井上皇后は呪詛による大逆を図ったとして突如皇后を廃された。
sen.e: Although Niigasa's children seemed to have no chance to succeed the throne, all of a sudden, Empress Inoe was dethroned for her attempt to commit treason using the spell.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Although Niigasa's children seemed to have no chance of succeeding the throne, suddenly Empress Inoe was dethroned due to her attempt to commit treason using a spell.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Although it appeared as though Niigasa's children stood no chance of succeeding the imperial throne, Empress Inoe was suddenly dethroned in 722 for plotting to commit treason using a curse.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 皇后が生んだ他戸親王も皇太子を廃されて都から追放され、二年後に井上内親王と他戸親王は幽閉先で相次いで死去した。
sen.e: Inoe's child, Imperial Prince Osabe was also dethroned, and was expelled from Kyoto, and then after two years, they passed away at the place where they were confined one after the other.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Inoe's child, Imperial Prince Osabe, was also dethroned and expelled from Kyoto, and two years later they passed away at the place where they were confined, one after the other.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Empress's child, Imperial Prince Osabe, was also deposed from his status as crown prince before being expelled from the capital, and two years later Imperial Princess Inoe and Imperial Prince Osabe passed away in succession at the place to which they were confined.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。原文に合わせピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: この皇后・皇太子廃位は藤原百川らによる陰謀であったという。
sen.e: This dethronement was intrigued by FUJIWARA no Momokawa and others.
This dethronement was the work of intrigue by FUJIWARA no Momokawa and others.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is said that the dethronement of the empress and the crown prince was a conspiracy by FUJIWARA no Momokawa and others.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 出自の卑しい新笠自身が皇后になることはなかったが、新笠が生んだ山部親王が立太子し、桓武天皇（在位：781年 - 806年）となる。
sen.e: Niigasa didn't become an empress as her origin was low; however her child, Imperial Prince Yamanobe was formally installed as Crown Prince, and became Emperor Kanmu (his reign was from 781 to 806)

Niigasa didn't become an empress, since her origin was low; however, her child, Imperial Prince Yamanobe, was formally installed as the Crown Prince and became Emperor Kanmu (his reign was from 781 to 806).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Niigasa didn't become an empress due to her low social status but her child, Imperial Prince Yamanobe, was installed as the Crown Prince and went on to become Emperor Kanmu (he reigned from 781 to 806).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 桓武即位に際しては同母弟である早良親王が立太子された。
sen.e: When Yamanobe ascended the throne, Imperial Prince Sawara (Yamanobe's younger brother with the same mother) was formally installed as Crown Prince.
When Yamanobe ascended the throne, Imperial Prince Sawara (Yamanobe's younger brother by the same mother) was formally installed as the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: When Emperor Kanmu ascended to the imperial throne, his younger brother by the same mother, Imperial Prince Sawara, was named as crown prince.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ハイフンをカンマにしました。

sen.j: しかし、早良親王は785年、藤原種継事件に連座して淡路へ流され、その途次に絶食して自ら命を絶った。
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Sawara was involved with the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu,and he was expelled to Awaji in 785; he killed himself without eating.
However, Imperial Prince Sawara was involved in the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu and was therefore expelled to Awaji in 785; he starved himself to death.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, Imperial Prince Sawara was implicated in the assassination of FUJIWARA no Tanetsugu, and exiled to Awaji but starved himself to death on the way.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 新笠は桓武天皇の即位後、皇太夫人と称せられた。
sen.e: Niigasa was referred to as Kotaifujin (title for previous retired emperors' wife) after Emperor Kanmu's enthronement.
Niigasa was referred to as Kotaifujin (a title for the wife of an emperor who had previously retired) after the enthronement of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Niigasa was referred to as Kotaifujin (a title for the wife of an emperor who had previously retired) after the enthronement of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 789年に死去すると790年に皇太后、806年に太皇太后を追贈された。
sen.e: After she passed away in 789, she was raised to Empress Dowager in 790, and to Grand Empress Dowager in 806.
After she passed away in 789, she was raised to Empress Dowager in 790 and then to Grand Empress Dowager in 806.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: After she passed away in 789, she was posthumously conferred the court rank of Empress Dowager in 790 and then Grand Empress Dowager in 806.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 墓は京都市西京区に高野新笠大枝陵（宮内庁管理）。
sen.e: Her tomb was TAKANO no Niigasa Oe ryo (Mausoleum) in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City (managed by Imperial Household Agency).
She was entombed at TAKANO no Niigasa Oe ryo (Mausoleum) in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City (managed by Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She was entombed at TAKANO no Niigasa Oe ryo (Mausoleum) in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City (managed by Imperial Household Agency).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 新笠の出自
sen.e: Niigasa's origin
Niigasa's Origins
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: Niigasa's Origins
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 父の和乙継は百済系渡来人の子孫で、カバネ（かばね）は和史（やまとのふびと）と推定されているが明らかではない。
sen.e: Her father, YAMATO no Ototsugu was a descendant of clans migrated from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in southern Korean Peninsula in Ancient periods), and his kabane (official status title) was assumed to be yamatonofubito, but it is uncertain.
sen.cmt: 和史（やまとのふびと）→yamatonobuhito と訳出しています（定訳不明のため）。→yamato no fubito [定訳不明]
sen.e: Her father, YAMATO no Ototsugu, was a descendant of clans that had migrated from Kudara (Baekje; one of three kingdoms in the southern Korean Peninsula in ancient periods), and his kabane (title of official status) was assumed to be Yamatonofubito, but that isn't certain.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Her father, YAMATO no Ototsugu, was a descendant of clans that had migrated from Kudara (Baekje; an ancient kingdom located in southwest Korea), and his kabane (hereditary title) is assumed to have been YAMATO no Fubito but this is not certain.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションを削除し表記を変えました。

sen.j: 白壁王の即位後、高野朝臣と改姓した。
sen.e: She changed her name into Takano no asomi after Shirakabe no okimi's enthronement.
sen.cmt: 高野朝臣→Takano no asomi と訳出しています （定訳不明のため）。
sen.e: She changed her name to Takano no asomi after Shirakabe no okimi's enthronement.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: She changed her name to TAKANO no Asomi after the enthronement of Shirakabe no Okimi.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 続日本紀延暦8年12月28日条に、次のようにある。
sen.e: According to the article of December 28 in 790 of Shoku Nihongi' (Chronicle of Japan Continued),
According to the article of December 28, 790 in 'Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued'),
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: The article of December 28, 790 in Shoku Nihongi (Chronicle of Japan Continued) is said as follows.
sen.cmt: 原文に「」がないので' '削除。一原文一訳文の例外対処。FBはありませんでしたが、ルールに従って原文、訳文を修正しました。

sen.j: 「皇太后姓は和氏、諱は新笠、贈正一位乙継の女（むすめ）なり。
sen.e: `The family name of Empress Dowager was yamatonofubito, her Imina was Niigasa, and she was the daughter of Ototsugu who was awarded Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
`The family name of Empress Dowager was Yamatonofubito, her Imina was Niigasa, and she was the daughter of Ototsugu, who was awarded Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) of the Empress Dowager was "Yamato", her imina (personal name) was "Niigasa", and she was the daughter of Ototsugu who held the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank).'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従ってかっこを補足しました。

sen.j: 母は贈正一位大枝朝臣真妹なり。
sen.e: Her mother was Oe Asomi Haji who was awarded Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
sen.cmt: 大枝朝臣真妹→Oe Asomi Haji と訳出しています（定訳不明のため）。
sen.e: Her mother was Oe Asomi Haji, who was awarded Shoichii (Senior First Rank).
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: Her mother was OE no Asomi Maimo, who held the rank of Shoichii (Senior First Rank).'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従ってかっこを補足しました。読みを変更しました。

sen.j: 后の先は百済武寧王の子純陁太子より出ず。
sen.e: The origin of the Empress Dowager was 純陁 Taishi, a child of Kudara (Paekche) Muryeong-wang.
sen.cmt: 純陁→読み方不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: The origin of the Empress Dowager was 純陁 Taishi, a child of Kudara (Paekche) Muryeong-wang.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Empress Dowager was the descendant of Crown Prince Sunta, son of King Muryeong of Baekje.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従ってかっこを補足しました。

sen.j: 、、、、皇太后曰く、其れ百済の遠祖都慕王は河伯の女日精に感じて生めるところなり、皇太后は即ち其の後なり。」
sen.e: According to the Empress Dowager, '
sen.cmt: B36 」は35にペーストしました。其れ百済の遠祖都慕王は河伯の女日精に感じて生めるところなり、皇太后は即ち其の後なり。の部分ですが文意が不明かつ検索不可能なため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: According to the Empress Dowager,'
sen.cmt: space
sen.e: According to the Empress Dowager, she is the descendant of the sun itself; for her distant Baekje ancestor King Tomo was the child born when the daughter of the Hebo river god felt the light of the sun against her.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従ってかっこを補足しました。

sen.j: 和氏が武寧王から出た百済王族であることを明らかにしている。
sen.e: It is clear that Yamatonofuruhito was from Muryeong-wang of Kudara (Paekche) royal family.
It is clear that Yamatonofuruhito was from Muryeong-wang of the Kudara (Paekche) royal family.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: It is clear that the Yamato clan descended from King Muryeong of the Baekje royal family.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Gradeが○になっていますが、「武寧王」は「Muryeong-wang」ではなく「King Muryeong」ですので、修正しました。本記事では、「百済」を「Paekche」ではなく「Baekje」に統一します。一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従って原文を修正しました。

sen.j: 日本書紀によれば継体天皇7年（西暦513年）百済太子淳陀死去とあり、純陁と淳陀が同一人物ではないかと考える学者も存在する。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), in 513, Kudara (Paekche) Taishi (prince) 淳陀 passed away; some scholars believe that 純陁 is the same person as 淳陀.
sen.cmt: 純陁およびに淳陀の読みかたが不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: According to "Nihon Shoki (Chronicles of Japan"), in 513 Kudara (Paekche) Taishi (prince) 淳陀 passed away; however, some scholars believe that 純陁 was the same person as 淳陀.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), Prince Junda of Baekje passed away in 513, and there are scholars who believe that Sunta and Junda were the same person.
sen.cmt: 本記事では、「百済」を「Paekche」ではなく「Baekje」に統一します。FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせ、the yearを削除しました。

sen.j: ただし、朝鮮側の資料には武寧王の子として純陁、もしくは淳陀に比定できる人物が存在していない。
sen.e: However, the reference from Korea didn't contain the information on the person who can assume 純陁 or 淳陀 was a child of Muryeong-wang.
sen.cmt: 純陁およびに淳陀の読みかたが不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: However, documents from Korea don't contain any information regarding a person one could assume to be 純陁 or any support for 淳陀 being a child of Muryeong-wang.
sen.cmt: Please check if I have understood this correctly. Also, I don't think the use of kanji in this cell or the cell above will be easy for native speakers of English with no knowledge of Japanese.
sen.e: However, Korean sources contain no references to an individual who was the son of King Muryeong and could be assumed to be Sunta or Junda.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: このことをもって高野新笠の由来を懐疑的に見る説もある。
sen.e: From the above mentioned, some people are skeptical for the origin of TAKANO no Niigasa.
Therefore, some people are skeptical about the origins of TAKANO no Niigasa.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is for this reason that there are those who view the origins of TAKANO no Niigasa with skepticism.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.j: また、淳陀太子の没年と高野新笠の推定生年（710年 - 720年）には200年以上の開きがある。
sen.e: Besides, more than the gap of 200 years exists between the year in which Taishi died and the assumed year in which TAKANO no niigasa was born (710-720).
Additionally, there is a gap of more than 200 years between the year in which Taishi died and the presumed year in which TAKANO no niigasa was born (710-720).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: In addition, there is a discrepancy of more than 200 years between the year in which Prince Junda died and the estimated year in which TAKANO no Niigasa was born (710 - 710).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 和氏が百済系渡来人といっても百済王氏のような今来（いまき）の帰化人ではなく、相当な古来である。
sen.e: Even if Yamato no fubito was a descendent of clans migrated from Kudara, he must be the citizen that had been naturalized long before not such as the citizen that have just naturalized as "Imaki" (just arrived).

Even if Yamato no fubito was a descendent of clans that had migrated from Kudara, he must have been naturalized as a citizen long before, not simply as a citizen recently naturalized as "Imaki" (just arrived).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Even if the Yamato clan were settlers from Baekje, they were not naturalized new arrivals like the descendants of the Baekje royal family, but arrived considerably further back in time.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 和乙継の名前をみても相当日本化した帰化氏族だといえる。
sen.e: The name of YAMATO no Ototsugu identifies that he was a member of the clan who had been naturalized long before.
The name of YAMATO no Ototsugu indicates that he was a member of the clan that had been naturalized long before.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: YAMATO no Ototsugu's name also indicates that he was a member of a clan that had been naturalized as Japanese citizens.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: なお、天平宝字元年(757)に「大倭国」が「大和｣に改められた際、「大倭宿禰」などの字（あざな）もすべて「大和｣に改められており、もとは倭氏と名乗っていた可能性が極めて高い。
sen.e: When `Daiwakoku' was revised to 'Yamato,' all of Azana (characters) such as `Daiwa Sukune' including Daiwa were revised to `Yamamoto,' they were probably called as Washi at the beginning.
sen.cmt: 大倭国→Daiwakokuと訳出しています（読み方不明のため）。倭氏→Wa clan と訳出しています（定訳不明のため）。
sen.e: When 'Daiwakoku' was revised to 'Yamato,' all of the azana (characteristics) such as `Daiwa Sukune,' including Daiwa, were revised to `Yamamoto,' but it is likely that they were called Washi in the beginning.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: When the characters used to write Yamato Province (大倭国) was changed to '大和' in 757, the characters in all azana (common names) such as 'YAMATO no Sukune' (大倭宿禰) also changed to 'YAMATO' (大和), and it is highly likely that the name of the Yamato clan was originally written using the characters 倭.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。 the yearを削除し、クォーテーションや表記などを変えました。

sen.j: 和乙継の牧野墓は奈良県広陵町にあるバクヤ塚が推定されているが、これは馬見古墳群に属する「古墳」であって築造年代が異なる。
sen.e: The Makino cemetery of YAMATO no Ototsugu was assumed to beバクヤ塚, it was the `ancient tomb' that belong to Umami burial mounds, and were built at different times.
sen.cmt: バクヤ塚→Bakuyazauka としています。
sen.e: The Makino cemetery of YAMATO no Ototsugu was assumed to beバクヤ塚, an 'ancient tomb' belonging to the Umami burial mounds, which were built at various times.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Makino grave of YAMATO no Ototsugu is assumed to be the Bakuya-zuka burial mound in Koryo-cho, Nara Prefecture, but this is a kofun (tumulus) of the Umami burial mounds, which were all constructed in different periods.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。地名を変更しました。

sen.j: また、「高野」の字（あざな）は、こんにちの奈良市高の原に比定される。
sen.e: The characters (Azana) of `Takano' is assumed to be present-day Takanohara, Nagoya city.
The characteristics (azana) of 'Takano' are assumed to indicate present-day Takanohara, Nagoya City.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Additionally, the azana 'Takano' is thought to correspond to present-day Takanohara in Nara City.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 神功陵古墳の裏手にあたる新興住宅地である。
sen.e: It is the new residential area located at the back of Jingu ryo (mausoleum) ancient tomb.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is the new residential area located at the back of the ancient tomb, or Jingu ryo (mausoleum).
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: It is the new residential area located behind the Mausoleum of Empress Jingu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 『万葉集』では鹿の音もわびしい山野と詠まれ、当時、孝謙天皇の陵がおかれたばかりであって、本貫地・居住地としての実体はまったくない。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves), it was described as dreary field, and ryo (mausoleum) of Emperor Koken had been just built, and was not recognized as a registered address or residential area.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In "Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves") it was described as a dreary field, and the ryo (mausoleum) of Emperor Koken had recently been built but was not recognized as a registered address or residential area.
sen.cmt: grammar, punctuation
sen.e: In "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) it was described as a bleak area, and the mausoleum of Empress Koken had recently been built there but it area had no significance as a honganchi (place written in a family register) or a residential area.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました（女性天皇なので）。

sen.j: 近傍には土師氏の根拠地である菅原伏見、また秋篠があり、菅原寺などが営まれている。
sen.e: sugawarafushimi and Akishino were near the site where SUGAWARA-ji temple and AKISHINO-ji temple were operated.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。菅原寺→SUGAWARA-ji temple秋篠寺→AKISHINO-ji temple と訳出しています。
sen.e: Sugawarafushimi and Akishino were near the site where the SUGAWARA-ji and AKISHINO-ji temples were operated.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Nearby were the Haji clan bases of Sugawarafushimi and Akishino in which temples including Sugawara-ji Temple stood.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また長岡京が大枝におかれなどしているところからみても、母方の土師氏一族が貴族として重んじられていったことはあきらかで、百姓であった父方とは好対照を示す。
sen.e: Since Nagaokakyo was placed in Oe, it is clear that the Haji clan on his mother's side was deemed important as a court noble, which was in contrast to his father's side as a farmer,
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Because Nagaokakyo was located in Oe, it is clear that the Haji clan on his mother's side was deemed important as court nobility, which was in contrast to the status of his father's side as farmers.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Even considering that Nagaoka-kyo (the ancient capital of Nagaoka) was located in Oe, it is clear that the Haji clan of her mother's side were revered as nobles, which was a marked contrast to the status of her father's side commoners.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 高野朝臣と改姓されたのちの和氏一族のその後は、ほとんどわかっていない。
sen.e: It is almost unknown what happened to the Yamato clan after their name was revised to Takano no asomi.
Little is known of what happened to the Yamato clan after their name was revised to Takano no asomi.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Little is known of what happened to the Yamato clan after their name was revised to TAKANO no Asomi.
sen.cmt: Takano no asomi→TAKANO no Asomi

sen.j: 平野神社と久度神社
sen.e: Hirano-jinja Shrine and Kudo-jinja Shrine
The Hirano-jinja and Kudo-jinja Shrines
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Hirano-jinja and Kudo-jinja Shrines
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 現・京都市北区 (京都市)平野宮本町に鎮座する延喜式名神大社平野神社は高野新笠と縁の深い神社である。
sen.e: Engishikimyojin-taisha Shrine Hirano Jinja Shrine located in present-day Hirano Miyamoto chou in North ward, Kyoto City had a deep relationship with TAKANO no Niigasa.
The Engishikimyojin-taisha and Hirano Jinja shrines, located in present-day Hirano Miyamoto chou in the North (Kita) Ward of Kyoto City, had a deep relationship with TAKANO no Niigasa.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The Engishiki myojin taisha (shrine listed in Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers)), Hirano-jinja Shrine located in present-day Hiranomiyamoto-cho, Kita Ward, Kyoto City, had a deep connection to TAKANO no Niigasa.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。「延喜式名神大社」の訳語を修正しました。

sen.j: 平野神社の祭神は今木神、久度神、古開神、比咩神の四座で、平安京遷都によって京都に遷座した。
sen.e: The four enshrined deities of Hirano-jinja Shrine; Imakino-kami, Kudono-kami, Fukurakino-kami, Himeno-kami, were transferred to Kyoto, due to the transfer of national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.

The four enshrined deities of Hirano-jinja Shrine--Imakino-kami, Kudono-kami, Fukurakino-kami and Himeno-kami--were transferred to Kyoto due to the transfer of the national capital to the city of Heian-kyo.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: The four enshrined deities of Hirano-jinja Shrine; Imaki-no-kami, Kudo-no-kami, Fukuraki-no-kami and Hime-no-kami, were transferred to Kyoto due to the transfer of the national capital to Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.j: 今木神の今木は今来のことで、渡来人を意味する。
sen.e: Imaki of Imakino-kami is `arrived' and means toraijin (people from overseas, especially from China and Korea, who settled in early Japan and introduced Continental culture to the Japanese).

Imaki' of Imakino-kami is 'arrived' and means toraijin (people from overseas, particularly those from China and Korea, who settled in early Japan and introduced Asian continental culture to the Japanese).
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: The "Imaki" of "Imaki-no-kami" means "newly arrived" and signifies the peoples who settled in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 平城京時代に田村後宮にあった今木大神は高野新笠と山部親王が祭祀していたことが判明している。
sen.e: Imakino-Okami which was placed in Tamurakokyu in the period of Heijo-kyo was enshrined by TAKANO no Niigasa and Imperial Prince Yamanobe.
Imakino-Okami, which was placed in Tamurakokyu in the period of Heijo-kyo, was enshrined by TAKANO no Niigasa and Imperial Prince Yamanobe.
sen.cmt: punctuation
sen.e: It has been determined that Imakino-Okami of Tamurakokyu during the period of Heijo-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Nara) was enshrined by TAKANO no Niigasa and Imperial Prince Yamanobe.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語補足しました。

sen.j: また久度神は竃神とされ、この神を祭るのは現・奈良県北葛城郡王寺町の延喜式内社・久度神社だけである。
sen.e: In addition, Kudono-kami was regarded as Kamadogami (the god of kitchen stove), and Kundo-kami was enshrined in Engishikinai-sha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws) and Kudo-jinja Shrine in present-day Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun County, Nara Prefecture only.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, Kudono-kami was regarded as Kamadogami (the god of kitchen stoves), and Kundo-kami was enshrined in Engishikinai-sha (a shrine listed in the Engishiki laws) and Kudo-jinja Shrine in the present-day Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun County, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Moreover, Kudono-kami was regarded as Kamadogami (the god of kitchen stoves), and Kundo-kami was enshrined in the Engishikinaisha (a shrine listed in the Engishiki laws) Kudo-jinja Shrine in modern-day Oji-cho, Kitakatsuragi-gun County, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その近くには和乙継の墓もあることから、百済系渡来人和氏が祭祀していた神とされる。
sen.e: Since the tomb of YAMATO no Ototsugu was near Kudono-kami, Kundo-kami was regarded as the god enshrined by Kazuuji, a descendent of clans migrated from Kudara.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Because the tomb of YAMATO no Ototsugu was near Kudono-kami, Kundo-kami was regarded as the god enshrined by Kazuuji, a descendent of clans that had migrated from Kudara.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Because the tomb of YAMATO no Ototsugu is located nearby, it is thought that Kundo-no-kami was enshrined by the Yamato clan which came to Japan from Baekje.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: とすれば和氏の本拠地はもともとこのあたりと推定される。
sen.e: Therefore, the base of Kazuuji is assumed to be around here.
Therefore, the base of Kazuuji is assumed to be in this area.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is for this reason that the stronghold of the Yamato clan is assumed to be in this area.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 平野神社の久度神は平城京の内膳司に祭られていたというから、王寺町の久度神社から平城宮に移り、さらに平野神社に移ったと考えられている。
sen.e: Since Kundo-kami of Hirano-jinja Shrine had been enshrined in Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of Heijo-kyu Palace, Kundo-kami was transferred from Kudo-jinja Shrine to Heijo-kyu Palace, then was transferred to Hirano-jinja Shrine.

However, since Kundo-kami of Hirano-jinja Shrine had been enshrined in Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of Heijo-kyu Palace, Kundo-kami was transferred from Kudo-jinja Shrine to Heijo-kyu Palace and was subsequently transferred to Hirano-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However because Kundo-no-kami of Hirano-jinja Shrine had been enshrined in the Naizenshi (Imperial Table Office) of Heijo-kyo, it is thought that Kundo-no-kami was transferred from Kudo-jinja Shrine in Oji-cho to Heijo-kyu Palace before being subsequently transferred to Hirano-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。原文に合わせました。

sen.j: 八幡信仰
sen.e: the Hachiman shinko, believing the God of War (Hachiman-god)
The Hachiman shinko, believing the God of War (Hachiman-god)
sen.cmt: case
sen.e: Belief in Hachiman
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 奈良時代、新羅との関係が緊張すると、宇佐から八幡神が上京し、和気清麻呂の託宣でも知られるように、にわかにその信仰が高まった。
sen.e: In Nara period, as the relationship with Silla was strained, Hachimanjin (the god of Hachiman-gu Shrine) came to Kyoto from Usa; the belief of Jachimanjin increased as shown in the case of an oracle by WAKE no Kiyomaro.

In the Nara period, as the relationship with Silla was strained, Hachimanjin (the god of Hachiman-gu Shrine) came to Kyoto from Usa; consequently, the belief in Jachimanjin increased, as shown in the case of the oracle WAKE no Kiyomaro.
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: As the relationship with Silla became strained during the Nara period, Hachimanshin (God of War) was transferred from Usa to Kyoto and, as demonstrated by the case in which the deity appeared to WAKE no Kiyomaro as an oracle, belief in Hachiman suddenly increased.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。読みと補足を用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 八幡神は神功皇后、応神天皇を祭ったものとされ、三韓平定の説話をともなうことから朝敵や「異境の毒気」とされた渡来の悪疫を払うものと考えられた。
sen.e: Hachiman-shin was to enshrine Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin, it was regarded as the god to ward off Korean enemies or `poisonous air brought in from the foreign land' as the story of the subjugation of Sankan (three Korean Kingdoms) was linked to the god.

Hachiman-shin was to enshrine Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin, it was regarded as the god to ward off Korean enemies or 'poisonous air brought in from the foreign land,' as the story of the subjugation of Sankan (three Korean Kingdoms) was linked to that god.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It was thought that Hachimanshin was enshrined by Empress Jingu and Emperor Ojin, and the association of the deity with tales of the subjugation of the three Korean kingdoms meant that it was believed to purify enemies of the Imperial Court and plagues which arrived in Japan that were considered to be caused by 'poisonous air from foreign lands.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。用語を他と合わせ、ピリオドの位置、クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 神功皇后は母方に「渡来系氏族」の血を引く。
sen.e: Empress Jingu was `a descendant of clans migrated from Kudara'
Empress Jingu was 'a descendant of clans that had migrated from Kudara.'
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Empress Jingu was 'a descendant of clans that had migrated from Baekje.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Gradeが○になっていますが、本記事では、「百済」を「Kudara」ではなく「Baekje」に統一します。ピリオドの位置を変えました。

sen.j: それゆえに朝鮮半島を平定する権利があったと信じられていたならば、この時代に育った桓武天皇らが、新羅調伏のためにあいまいな母方の血筋を強調したのはきわめて当然のことであったといえよう。
sen.e: Therefore, it was natural that Emperor Kanmu emphasized his bloodline with uncertain origin on his mother's side in order to suppress Siira if he was believed to have the right to conquer the Korean Penninsula.

Therefore, it was natural that Emperor Kanmu emphasized his bloodline, with its uncertain origin on his mother's side, in order to suppress Siira if he was believed to have the right to conquer the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: OK
sen.e: It was therefore natural that emperors including Emperor Kanmu who grew up during this period would emphasize the ambiguous lineage of their mother in order to gain control of Silla if they believed that they had the right to conquer the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 孝謙・称徳天皇の時代、白壁王は暗殺を恐れ、大納言を致仕し郊外の田邑邸で酒色にふける「陽狂」の日々を送っていた。
sen.e: During the reigns of Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku, Shirakabe no okimi feared that he would be assassinated, he resigned as a chief councilor of state, and stayed at Tamura-tei (Tamura residence) in sunburn area, spending `exciting days' with alcohol.

During the reigns of Emperor Koken and Emperor Shotoku, Shirakabe no okimi feared that he would be assassinated, so he resigned as a chief councilor of state and stayed at Tamura-tei (Tamura residence) in a sunbathing area, where he spent 'exciting days' indulging in alcohol consumption.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: During the reigns of Empress Koken and Emperor Shotoku, Shirakabe no Okimi feared that he would be assassinated, so he resigned as dainagon (chief councilor of state) and stayed at the Tamura-tei residence in the suburbs where he spent 'wild' days indulging in the sensual pleasures of drink and women.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。前出に合わせクォーテーション補足しました。

sen.j: 当時は采女といって身分の低い女性が高貴な者に奉仕することがふつうだったので、采女である新笠がたまたま白壁王の目に止まり、枕席に侍り情を受けたというのが真相ではあるまいか。
sen.e: At that rime, it was common that court ladies from provinces serve the person with the noble status; it is probably true that Niigasa caught Shirakabe no okimi's eyes by chance, and received his love.

At that rime, it was common that court ladies from the provinces would serve persons of noble status; it is probably true that Niigasa caught Shirakabe no okimi's eyes by chance, whereupon she received his love.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: At that time, it was common for low-ranking ladies-in-waiting to serve persons of noble status, and it is probably true that Niigasa who served as a lady-in-waiting would occasionally catch the eye of Shirakabe no Okimi, attended at his bedside, and received his affection.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 帰化人の血筋の有用性を強調したのは、井上皇后一派を失脚・排斥したイメージを払拭するため、桓武擁立派の企てと見るのが自然だろう。
sen.e: Emphasizing the advantage of the bloodline as the notarized person was in order to clean up the bad impressions for the dethronement and exclusion of Empress Inoe, which was the scheme of the Emperor Kanmu force.

Emphasizing the advantage of the bloodline as the notarized person was in order to clean up the bad impression regarding the dethronement and exclusion of Empress Inoe, which was the scheme of forces on the side of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Emphasis of the emperor's lineage from naturalized settlers was done in order to overcome the negative image of having deposed and expelled Empress Inoe and her followers, and it is natural to regard the move as a plan formulated by the backers of Emperor Kanmu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
